instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery symbol on display
threads.message:
Small liquid damage on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> had jumpy voltage 5V-11V.

<RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR> on pin 1 was damaged, pad on board was burned out so I did jumper from pin 1 <CAPACITOR>C7184</CAPACITOR>.
Now I got only battery symbol on display.

Tested with: 
- 2 DC boards
- 2x 85W genuine charger
- 1 65W genuine charger
- 2x new battery

Replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> same issue.

Without battery there is only light on charger. No fan spin.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
- with charger 16V (with or without battery)
- without charger 6.5V (with flat batt), 7.1V (batt with 20% charge)

It wonâ€™t charge when battery is flat.
I connected battery with 20% and works fine, its charging battery as well but when battery is flat there is battery symbol on display.

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
17/18 3.4 ohms
27/28 20 ohms (There was a few million ohms before. Duke suggested in other post to check trace between <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> and there was not connected. Did jumper from pin 2 <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> to pin 4 <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> and pin 2 <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR> to pin 3 <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>).

Any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery symbol on display
threads.message: PPBUS at 16V with the charger is a problem, it should NEVER go over 12.6V. This would indicate a shorted <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> or a bad <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> or the traces to <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>. Replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> together as 1 may kill the other.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery symbol on display
threads.message:
Replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and PPBUS is now 8.5V,

Still the same issue: battery symbol on display.

Checked <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> both showing correct 2.0K ohms.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery symbol on display
threads.message: Use a known good battery with some charge in it and see if the charge goes up.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery symbol on display
threads.message:
I connected clients battery, but was flat.
Battery symbol what on display but after a few minutes battery start to charge and MacBook turns on.
All works - issue solver.

Many thanks
